notes_display: In Historical Sketches of the Paper Currency of the American Colonies by Henry Phillips, Jr. (1865). Given to Dr. Jesse C. Green in 1890. Leaf 96AD.
issue_place_s: New Jersey, United States of America
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: Spanish milled DOLLARS by the Thirty-first
issue_obverse_figure_relationship_s: THE Possessor of this Bill shall be paid THREE
issue_obverse_legend_s: Day of December, One Thousand Seven Hundred and Eighty-six, with Interest in like Money, at the Rate of Five per Centum per Annum, by the State of New-Jersey, according to an Act of the Legislature of the said State, of the Ninth Day of June, 1780.
issue_reverse_legend_s: The United States | Printed by HALL and SELLERS. | THE UNITED STATES ensure the Payment of the within BILL, and will draw Bills of Exchange for the Interest annually, if demanded, according to a Resolution of CONGRESS, of the 18th of March, 1780.
